thread.title: Jennifer Lawrence and Boyhood's Richard Linklater drop Sony's The Rosie Project
thread.title_full: Jennifer Lawrence and Boyhood's Richard Linklater drop Sony's The Rosie Project

author: Ebony Bowden
title: Jennifer Lawrence and Boyhood's Richard Linklater drop Sony's The Rosie Project
text:
Jennifer Lawrence has signed on to play Rosie Jarman in the film adaptation of The Rosie Project . The book is set in Melbourne, but will the film follow suit? Photo: Phil McCarten 
The Rosie Project filming in Melbourne? Jennifer Lawrence to star in 'The Rosie Project' Rosy film future for Rosie Project Oscar winner Jennifer Lawrence and Boyhood director Richard Linklater have both reportedly pulled out of the film adaptation of Australian author Graeme Simsion's best-selling novel The Rosie Project .
In a blow to both Linklater and Simsion, the 25-year-old dropped the project this week due to scheduling conflicts, according to  The Hollywood Reporter . Linklater soon followed suit. 
Boyhood actor Ellar Coltrane and director Richard Linklater 
The rights to the book were acquired by Sony last year, with Lawrence reported to have signed on in July to play lead character, bartender Rosie Jarman.
Advertisement The film was reportedly developed as a vehicle for Lawrence, and Linklater, who earned six Oscar nominations for Boyhood , signed on as an opportunity to work with the actress.
Fairfax Media has contacted Graeme Simsion for comment.
The Rosie Project 
The Rosie Project , which follows genetics professor Don Tillman as he struggles to find the perfect girl, is set in Melbourne and could have been a major win for the Australian film industry.
In an interview with Fairfax , Film Victoria chief Jenni Tosi said there had been initial discussions with the film's producer about locating The Rosie Project in Melbourne.
"We'd be delighted if Melbourne was selected, however the project is still in development and many factors come into play," she said.
Lawrence, who is Hollywood's most bankable female star, reportedly walked away from the project in need of a break.
The actress just finished filming  X-Men: Apocalypse and went straight into sci-fi film  Passengers with Chris Pratt, with the studio hoping to film Rosie in the following months.
The film could still go ahead with Lawrence and Linklater at the helm, with Australian film The Dressmaker waiting more than a year for Kate Winslet to play the female lead.
Author Graeme Simsion previously  told Fairfax The Rosie Project had been developed as a film from the beginning, with the novel starting as a film script while Simsion was studying screenwriting at RMIT.
